headers: All machines are immediately available for continuous processing when jobs are arrived simultaneously in an HFS;
rows: No machine can perform more than one operation at a time;
An operation is not allowed to be processed on more than one machine;
For the same job, any parallel machine at a stage takes equal processing time;
Both the set-up time for job processing and the travel time between stages are negligible;
To avoid the blocking of machines, there are infinite buffers between stages;
Job processing may take longer or shorter processing time than expected;
Since a stage consists of a number of functionally identical parallel machines, these machines have the same CPTV.
The CPTV, however, may be different for the machines at other stages.
Number of parallel machines per stage

tables.table_title: Response value and rank of each parameter.
Comparison of algorithms under normal processing times.
headers:
Problem size
No. of jobs $\times$ no. of stages
No. of parallel machines at each stage
